events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords referencing a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and communicate with the claimant about next steps.
The insurance agent acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process would begin immediately.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report to support the investigation.
The customer submitted the required documents, including detailed photos of the damaged car and the official accident report.
The insurer began a formal investigation into the circumstances of the collision and the extent of the vehicle damage.
Investigation confirmed that the claimant was not at fault and damage estimates were verified by the expert.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover all repair costs plus a rental car allowance during the repair period.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was formally approved and processing for payment release began immediately.
The insurance company issued the payment to cover repair costs and rental reimbursement as agreed in the settlement.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all payments were received and the vehicle was repaired.
The claim file was archived as per company policy for record keeping and future reference if necessary.
